data.title: Prevent spam on servers
data.body:
Seen alot of people spamming URL's or just griefing chat... this can be a real pain when the other players are trying to realy organize the match.

data.title: Harvester Logic
data.body:
Harvesters seem to be following a vector when gathering resources. This usually results in them driving far from the local ore refinery, when there may be a closer, safer supply of ore. I've had a look at FindResources and it pretty much needs a re-write.

Currently it only accounts for the ore trucks last location while collecting ore. I want to propose three new features, of course with the original logic heuristics : Select the closest resource cell based on 
1) Distance from local refinery
2) Amount of ore in the location
3) likeliness of attack

To do this I wanted to run this methodology passed you guys before commencing work on it.

1) Apply split and merge to section areas of ore. Stop decomposing at some area covered by the ore. (Unsupervised classification like mean-shift may be better but probably slower)
2) Update each cluster with the ore positions, and number of enemies in the cluster
3) Compute the distance between the local refinery to each centroid.
4) Find the safest and most valuable clusters using these three parameters.
5) Bypass this system if the user clicks on a ore location - Treat the clicked ore location as the local refinery CPos.
6) Once the cluster is selected, the harvester will collect the resource closest to either the last users click or the refinery, not the last position of the truck.

It is probably faster to partition the scene on initialisation and enable/disable resource cells as they are collected/spawn.

Luke

data.title: Infiltration refactor
data.body: Refactors stuff to make new spy abilities a bit easier to implement.

data.title: Fix instant-use and AllowMultiple support powers.
Made the lobby notifications less spammy and added some more cases
data.body: A followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6108 as discussed in IRC.

data.title: Move Power out of Building and into its own trait
data.body: This should allow for non-buildings to provide and use power.

data.title: Vote Kick Specs in Game
data.body: Just had a game where someone was abusing their power as a spectator. What do you guys think about active players having the power to kick spectators?

data.title: Ability to Reconnect
data.body:
Even in this day and age where fibre is being thrown around like confetti, some of us still have shitty Internet connections for various geographical/financial/spiritual reasons, not to mention occasional game or straight up computer crashes, and having a player drop out in the middle of a good match is just maddening.

Would be really awesome to be able to reconnect to a multiplayer game and continue playing. I kinda envision it working like Tiberian Sun did, where you'd get a dialog when someone was disconnected, with the option to vote the disconnected player out and continue playing without them. Tiberian sun had a countdown, but I don't really see any point in that (or at the very least it should be optional).

It would be even more awesome to be able to rejoin following a crash. Obviously this raises a number of concerns like how do you know it's the same player reconnecting being one of them (maybe every client generates a static signature on first run or something?) but would be really cool.

data.title: TechTree refactor
Overhaul production hotkeys
data.body:
This changes the sidebar production hotkeys to a configurable slot-based assignment as used in C&C3 and RA3 (the earlier games didn't have production hotkeys).

The default hotkeys are set to the F-keys (as C&C3 and RA3 did), which is a safe but non-optimal choice.  Players can adjust them in the settings menu to whatever they wish.

Fixes #3915, #4142, #4181, #6031.

data.title: Minor fixes (IonCannon and Bridge).
data.body:
While doing the CustomWarhead refactor, I noticed two minor things:

IonCannon effect applies the weapon impact at the end of the animation, rather than after some delay.
This means the ion cannon visual fades before the actors are hit by anything.
I've made a change to allow a weapon impact delay to be specified instead (ticks from start of animation).

Secondly, on in Bridge, for demolish the weapon is currently hardcoded to "Demolish".
I've changed to make this definable. Default = "Demolish".

https://github.com/UberWaffe/OpenRA/tree/MinorFixes

Haven't made a pull request yet, since it requires (will conflict with) #6030.

data.title: Fix AttackCharge not picking a new target if the current became invalid
data.body: This fixes #5568 by adding a IsReachableTarget check to properly handle units that walk out of range.

data.title: Implement Attack move + Left click
data.body:
Implement an option to use Attack move + left click for players comfortable with using the system similar to blizzard games.

More here: http://www.reddit.com/r/openra/comments/2c56cs/attack_move_left_click/

data.title: Yak vs Mig building attacks ("strong vs/weak vs buildings"), same damage
data.body:
The Yak's description says that it's weak against buildings whereas the Mig is supposed to be good vs buildings.

The Mig costs $2000 whilst the Yak is $1000.
When the Yak attacks a basic Power Plant, it will have around 10% of its hitpoints left after the attack. The same applies to a Mig attack fighter. Around 10% of a Power Plants hitpoints are left.... It's weird since the latter costs twice as much, but seems to deal the same amount of damage despite the descriptions. Furthermore the Mig takes more time to empty its load compared to the Yak.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3427051-yak-vs-mig-building-attacks-strong-vs-weak-vs-buildings-same-damage?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: RA1 Gap technology fails to work when Shroud is disabled
data.body:
What I mean is that if Shroud is turned off in the game settings (most of my friends like to play with it off because seeing the terrain is a huge thing if you don't remember the map), then units/buildings like the Gap Generator or the vehicle that does the same thing don't work at all. We tried and it basically did nothing.

Could this be fixed in any way so that the Allies don't lose 2 units when one game setting is turned off? :O

data.title: Allow playing around after the game is over?
data.body:
I think its sad i cant launch my nuke after the game ends, especially when my nuke is just 1 second away from launching.

I dont see why the game is preventing me from doing those things such as selling my stuff or building more stuff, or sending nukes etc.

If its about informing the player that the game is over, then that could be done other ways too, such as big transparent window for 10 seconds (which you could also close by clicking X), and a message in the chat such as "you have won! congratulations" etc.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3426612-allow-playing-around-after-the-game-is-over?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Add ITraitInfo constraint to Requires<T>
MAD tank explodes infantery
data.body:
Few days ago I encountered this during a regular RA game, latest release.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RhlWEvzfKH4&feature=youtu.be

After some testing, I think I found a reason for the excessive infantry spawning when the MAD tank explodes. Also in the first movie you see the infantry spawning out of nowhere.

Excessive infantry during explosion:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p7fEsqV_UNc&feature=youtu.be

Chrono the 'hammering' MAD tank and apply the excessive infantry trick. (Must be a two man job to do as I encountered it in the first movie). Also notice the final explosion of the MAD tank takes place at the chrono'd location.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CKX0dQrsNNI&feature=youtu.be

data.title: #6081 Surrender button grey out
data.body: sending setWinState of false prevented code from calling method to update. Removed setWinState as it didn't make sense to have it there. All it did was prevent a block of code from running.

data.title: Windows file system locking files is failing the CD installation
data.body:
![install-music](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1217312/3755632/dbb86884-1826-11e4-9041-7ab8e8eb84db.JPG)

I get this error as though it's not able to access the local file it just copied. When I go back to the menu and into music after the error all the music is present there, it even plays properly. Not sure what this error represents.

data.title: Migrate speed, damage/armor and firepower modifiers to integer
data.body:
Current state:
SpeedModifier seems to work fine.

DamageModifier currently does about twice as much damage as it should, probably a misplaced division op, haven't found the error yet.

FirepowerModifier leads to zero damage of tanks vs. infantry for example, so there's probably a misplaced division op as well.

data.title: Movement Delay for units
data.body:
![delay](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1217312/3755125/f30522ac-1821-11e4-82c8-a16a4daea65a.gif)

Seems like there is a fake delay in unit movement. Now this seems understandable when a unit needs to turn and then start moving. 

But if you repeatedly right-click the unit is clearly stopping even though there is no directional change.

It's as though each move command has a fake induced delay.

data.title: Some units can't forcefire on mines that are hidden under fog of war
data.body:
This arty won't shot or move.
![forcefirebuga](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3753393/d274771e-1811-11e4-85c8-a49082dc65dd.png)
![forcefirebugb](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3753394/d32fbc4a-1811-11e4-99d2-45446b6a61b2.png)

Appears for:
Artillery, V2 Rocket, APC, Tesla Tank, Giant Ant, Zombie, Shok Trooper, Flame Thrower, Rocket Soldier, Grenadier, Rifl Infantry and Missle Sub.

If the mine isn't hidden, it works.
It seems like this bug only appears with mines (both allies and soviet).

data.title: Add an actor upgrade system (+ overhauls veterancy and crates)
data.body:
This introduces a framework for actor-specific upgrade types as originally proposed in #5471 and prototyped in #5963.

Three upgrades sources are currently implemented:
- Veterancy (allowing per-level customization).
- Crates.
- Purchasable global upgrades.
#5471 can be resurrected as a fourth `PluggableUpgrade` source.

Two upgrade consumers are currently implemented: stats (firepower, speed, armor) and cloak.

f25c414742002973d961cc50975fc18a5c96cbd7 provides a testcase that exercises these abilities, which implements toy changes:
- All crates give cloak upgrades
- Mammoth tank speed upgrade (GDI defense queue)
- Infantry give experience from friendly fire to help test:
- Infantry veterancy bonuses:
  - 1 (2x value kills): Super firepower
  - 2 (4x value kills): Super speed
  - 3 (8x value kills): Cloak

data.title: Added a trait that removes an actor when prereqs are met, with delay.
data.body:
It is quite useful if you want a switch upgrade.
An example would be to upgrade rifleman to use bazookas, that unlocks an upgrade to revert them back to rifles, when that is researched it kills the actor that had the other prereqs so you don`t have both at once.

Its also quite funny to see all your powerplants explode when you build a barracks.
